definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: It looks like the President received illegal campaign donations.
sentences.chinese: 總統好像收受了非法的選舉賄金。

sentences.english: The banks shall accept the fines and turn them over directly to the State Treasury.
sentences.chinese: 銀行應當收受罰款，並將罰款直接上繳國庫。

sentences.english: There have even been high-ranking government officials arrested for taking bribes from drug traffickers.
sentences.chinese: 甚至有高級政府官員因涉嫌收受毒販賄賂而被捕。

sentences.english: Rub the cream, for heating, which is more easily absorbed by the skin.
sentences.chinese: 搓，給眼霜減溫，使之更隨便被肌膚收受。

sentences.english: But his sons did not walk in his ways. They turned aside after dishonest gain and accepted bribes and perverted justice.
sentences.chinese: 他兒子不行他的道，貪圖財利，收受賄賂，屈枉正直。

sentences.english: And his sons walked not in his ways, but turned aside after lucre, and took bribes, and perverted judgment.
sentences.chinese: 他兒子不行他的道，貪圖財利，收受賄賂，屈枉正直。

sentences.english: Can be received within six months of bank acceptance bills of exchange.
sentences.chinese: 可收受六個月內的銀行承兌匯票。

sentences.english: The officer ended up losing his job because he accepted a bribe.
sentences.chinese: 由於收受賄賂，這個官員最終丟掉了自己的紗帽。

sentences.english: Rwaserican denting rear endocinearionr level sensors work on the principle of electromagnetic waudio-videoe transmission and reception.
sentences.chinese: 雷達物位傳感器的處事原理是電磁波傳輸與收受。

sentences.english: Mmuch people complain that computers take over their jobaloney.
sentences.chinese: 許多人訴苦說計算機正在收受人的作事。

sentences.english: The bribes, according to the reports, helped him meet those needs.
sentences.chinese: 據該報導稱，收受的賄賂幫助他滿足了這些需要。

sentences.english: We learned lessons about humanity, about giving, about receiving, about service above self.
sentences.chinese: 我們從人性，施予，收受及超我服務等方面學習經驗。

sentences.english: Some former county officials have since been prosecuted for accepting bribes from bankers.
sentences.chinese: 該縣之前的一些官員因爲收受銀行的賄賂而被起訴。

sentences.english: A big fortune had been paid in backhanders to local officials and politicians.
sentences.chinese: 當地官員和政客收受了大筆的賄賂。

sentences.english: After collecting a large amount of hush money mr. chen fled out of china .
sentences.chinese: 收受大筆賄款後，陳先生逃出中國。

sentences.english: Solicitation, payment or receipt of bribes, gratuities or kickbacks.
sentences.chinese: 索取，支付或收受賄賂，賞金或回扣。

definition: to exact bribes/to solicit bribes/to demand bribes/to extort
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
to be a guest at a dinner party/to be wined and dined (as a bribe)
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
lack of discipline/to break a rule/to violate discipline/to breach a principle
to bend the law in order to favor one's relatives or associates (idiom)
